message.content:
cs.CR, cs.LO, cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.AI 

This paper deals with security access control policy and formal semantics, which are topics commonly found in the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also introduces a logic to capture the idea behind the XACML standard, which falls under the sub-category of cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science). Additionally, the paper discusses the compositionality of XACML policies, which is a topic in the sub-category of cs.SE (Software Engineering). The paper also mentions the use of D-algebra, which is a topic in the sub-category of cs.PL (Programming Languages). Finally, the paper's focus on formalization and semantics could also place it in the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
